data.title: The Importance of Toni Morrison
data.meta_description: However, we are talking about the first African-American woman to win a Nobel Prize in 1993 and whose literary legacy is essential to the black rights movement. She was a pioneer by nature and opened…
data.text:
To many, the name Toni Morrison sounds like an old singer whose glory years are far behind her.

However, we are talking about the first African-American woman to win a Nobel Prize in 1993 and whose literary legacy is essential to the black rights movement. She was a pioneer by nature and opened countless doors many people have since crossed.

Her novels dealt with some tragic chapters in the history of the United States, always with mastery and elegance of writing that captivated millions of people while raising their awareness. She was an inspiration for many generations, both anonymous and famous people. This is the case, for example, of Jordan Peele, whose films draw heavily from Morrison’s work.

Morrison wrote twelve novels throughout her career (in addition to essays and books of short stories), many stories in which never abandoned the goal of explaining the history of slavery in the United States. Also, the hardships of a black population that even today has not found its deserved place in a country that does not end up…
